original_data.question: A 20-year-old woman comes to the clinic for her first follow-up visit after being diagnosed with bipolar I disorder 1-month ago. At that time, she was acutely severely manic and was brought to the emergency department by her concerned boyfriend. She was started on lithium, and after subsequent improvement, she was discharged. A week after discharge, the patient forgot to take her medication for a few days and quickly began to manifest manic symptoms again which required brought her to the emergency department again. Since then, she has been compliant with her medications and currently has no significant complaints. Which of the following recommendations would be most helpful in minimizing the risk to the fetus in this patient?

options.A: Adjust dosage of medication throughout the pregnancy
options.B: Supplement all patients with 5mg of daily folic acid
options.C: Low-dose polytherapy is preferred over monotherapy
options.D: Switch to valproate as it has safest pregnancy profile

model_response:
The correct answer is B: Supplement all patients with 5mg of daily folic acid. Folic acid supplementation has been shown to reduce the risk of neural tube defects in the fetus. The other options are not recommended practices. It is not recommended to adjust dosage of medication throughout the pregnancy as this may lead to destabilization of the patient's condition. Low-dose polytherapy is not recommended over monotherapy as it is more likely to result in sub-therapeutic dosing. Valproate is not recommended over lithium as it has been associated with hepatotoxicity and other risks to the fetus.

###Answer: OPTION B IS CORRECT.</s><s>

question_entities.definition: Those facilities which administer health services to individuals who do not require hospitalization or institutionalization.

The determination of the nature of a disease or condition, or the distinguishing of one disease or condition from another. Assessment may be made through physical examination, laboratory tests, or the likes. Computerized programs may be used to enhance the decision-making process.
The dimension of the physical universe which, at a given place, orders the sequence of events. (McGraw-Hill Dictionary of Scientific and Technical Terms, 6th ed)
Excitement of psychotic proportions manifested by mental and physical hyperactivity, disorganisation of behaviour and elevation of mood.
Hospital department responsible for the administration and provision of immediate medical or surgical care to the emergency patient.
A boy or man who is the lover of a girl or woman.
An element in the alkali metals family. It has the atomic symbol Li, atomic number 3, and atomic weight [6.938; 6.997]. Salts of lithium are used in treating BIPOLAR DISORDER.
A condition superior to an earlier condition.
The administrative process of discharging the patient, alive or dead, from hospitals or other health facilities.
Any period of seven consecutive days.
The pouring forth of a fluid.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.
The time for Earth to make a complete rotation on its axis; ordinarily divided into twenty-four hours, equal to 86 400 seconds. This also refers to a specific day.
Hospital department responsible for the administration and provision of immediate medical or surgical care to the emergency patient.
Drugs intended for human or veterinary use, presented in their finished dosage form. Included here are materials used in the preparation and/or formulation of the finished dosage form.
A symptom or problem for which a patient seeks medical attention.
Advice telling someone what the best thing to do is.
The probability that an event will occur. It encompasses a variety of measures of the probability of a generally unfavorable outcome.

The unborn young of a viviparous mammal, in the postembryonic period, after the major structures have been outlined. In humans, the unborn young from the end of the eighth week after CONCEPTION until BIRTH, as distinguished from the earlier EMBRYO, MAMMALIAN.
Individuals participating in the health care system for the purpose of receiving therapeutic, diagnostic, or preventive procedures.
